Package fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.examples.molene

Molene example of a DEVS simulation architecture.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    MoleneModel
    The class MoleneModel implements the DEVS coupled model used to assemble all of the DEVS models used in the Molene example.
    SimulationMain
    The class SimulationMain constructs a simulation architecture for the Molene experiment (Maria-Teresa Segarra Ph.D. thesis).
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Decision
    The enumeration Decision defines the three possible adaptations i.e., to go to the compression mode, to go to the no compression mode and to go to the low battery mode where the compression will not be used to save battery life.
    State
    The enumeration State defines the different states in which the Molene system can be.

Package fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.examples.molene Description

Molene example of a DEVS simulation architecture.

This package proposes an example of a DEVS simulation architecture built around the concepts of the Molene system designed by Maria-Teresa Segarra in her thesis (IRISA/U. Rennes I).

Molene is a system that aims at optimising the data flow between a PC running on battery and a server that are connected through a WiFi network. The idea is to use data compression to lower the bandwidth requirements and get a better data transfer rate when the WiFi bandwidth is low. However, as the PC runs on battery, compressing and uncompressing requires more processing and therefore drains the battery faster. Hence, to save battery life, compression must only be used when the bandwidth is low.

The package fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.examples.molene
